activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A Mortensen

defendant.name: Mortensen, Gregory A

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Gregory A Mortensen appeared by video, in custody, in Washburn County.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Gregory A Mortensen.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
9:31 AM Detective Michael Carroll of Barron County, called, sworn and direct by State.
9:36 AM  Cross by Attorney Rockow.  

Court finds probable cause and binds over.
Next hearing may be by zoom if DE is still in custody.
Arraignment scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Gregory A Mortensen appeared by video, in custody at Washburn County Jail.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Gregory A Mortensen.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rockow relates Defendant is on a probation hold with revocation in Washburn.  Request for Substitution made.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

10:08 AM Defendant Gregory A Mortensen appeared by video, in custody from Washburn County jail.  Attorney Michael J Steuer appeared (for today) by video for Gregory A Mortensen.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

10:08  Court relates and gives appearances.
Defendant qualifies for Public Defender services; counsel has not yet been appointed..
Atty. Steuer and defendant go into break-out room; 10:23 return from break-out room.
Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
AIA set before Judge Bitney; appear in person, unless still in jail.
Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(Bond and MS forwarded to Washburn Co Jail)
(Copy of MS scanned to Barro Co Jail)
